name: Tier 1 Spell Fumbles (Levels 1-4)
description: Fumble effects for spell attacks at Tier 1 (Levels 1-4). Effects are relatively mild for novice adventurers.

results.text: Nothing Special - Your spell fizzles harmlessly with no additional penalty.
Magical Feedback - The spell's energy rebounds slightly. Take 1d4 force damage.
Arcane Hiccup - Your magic stutters. Your next spell attack has disadvantage.
Visual Distortion - The spell creates brief visual noise. You have disadvantage on Perception checks until the end of your next turn.
Spell Slot Strain - The failed casting strains your magical reserves. Your next spell that requires a spell slot costs an additional slot of 1st level (if you have one).
Wild Magic Spark - A tiny surge of wild magic occurs. DM rolls on a minor effect table or chooses a harmless cosmetic effect (hair changes color, flowers bloom nearby, etc.).
Component Mishap - A material component is accidentally destroyed or consumed. Lose one use of a material component you were using (if applicable).
Self-Target - Your spell briefly affects you instead of your target. Take the spell's effect on yourself at half damage (or the effect with a DC 10 save, if applicable).
